titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Georiana Goddard King (1871-1939) graduated from Bryn Mawr in 1896 with a bachelor's degree in English and, in 1897, a master's degree in philosophy and political science. She taught at Bryn Mawr, first in the English department, and later she was appointed Lecturer in History of Art and Comparative Literature. In 1913 she became the first chair of the History of Art department. She was an authority on Spanish painting.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the professional papers of Georgiana Goddard King. Materials include research and lecture notes on Spanish and Italian art and literature, manuscripts and articles, reprints, and a small amount of correspondence. Also included are a reminiscence of King by her friend Delphine Darby, and memorials and an obituary.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

otherfindaid.p: A paper finding aid is available in the repository.
